purposeShort: Manage onboarding and due diligence for new customer accounts.
purposeLong: Customer applications are collected through a digital portal, validated against third-party identity providers, and assessed for onboarding approval. The platform coordinates internal teams and external partners to complete KYC and AML checks.
legalbasisLong: Processing is necessary to onboard customers, satisfy regulatory obligations under AML/KYC legislation, and maintain accurate contractual records for account servicing.
dataOrigin: Collected directly from applicants via secure portals and supplemented with sanctioned third-party KYC providers and public registers.
profiling: Automated profiling assesses risk levels and triggers manual review for high-risk indicators. Human oversight validates any automated decisions before final approval.
timeLimit: Seven years after account closure, unless legal holds require extension.
communications: Encrypted email updates to compliance officers
communicationsLong: All communications with regulators and applicants are logged automatically. Sensitive disclosures are routed through the encrypted correspondence module.
transfersLong: Data transfers to infrastructure providers remain within the EEA. Vendor subprocessors undergo annual transfer impact assessments and implement SCCs.
securityMeasuresLong: Platform enforces FIPS-compliant encryption, role-based access control, adaptive MFA, continuous vulnerability scanning, and quarterly penetration testing.
contracts: Data processing agreements signed with all processors and subprocessors. Contract repository reference: DPA-KYC-2025-08.
